result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas David Hamilton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Public Record or Copy, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent SHALL notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment SHALL be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to pay court costs.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 

Defendant is to comply with any treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas David Hamilton

records.addlTxt: 2:01 PM ADA Diaz appears in person for the state. Defendant appears in person, in custody from the TC Jail. Attorney Flottmeyer appears in person. State complied with VRL. Joint recommendation presented to the court. Court advised defendant of rights/max penalties. Defendant KVI waives all rights/max penalties and enters NC plea to count 1. Court finds defendant G of count 1. Defendant sentenced. Count 2, count 3, count 4, count 5 and count 6 are DRI.

Attorney William P Flottmeyer appeared by video for Nicholas David Hamilton. Defendant can see/hear okay. Defense requesting to set for PLEAS. PLEAS set. Bond cont.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Flottmeyer advised defendant waives reading of information and stands mute. Court enters NG pleas on defendant's behalf. STC set. Bond cont.

11:05 AM Prosecuting attorney John Harrison Sacia appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Nicholas David Hamilton appeared in court, in custody, Attorney William P Flottmeyer appeared in court for Nicholas David Hamilton. Def wishes to waive right to PH. Court advised def right to PH. Def KVI waives right to PH. Court finds def KVI waives right to PH. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for further proceedings. Information filed. Atty Flottmeyer states def waives reading of information and stands mute. Court enters NG plea on defendant's behalf. Defense advised does not need PTC, has had discussions with the state. Defendant has cases open in Barron STC set. Bond to continue.
